decks.notes: The deck focuses on using control elements to protect key creatures like Knight of the Reliquary, Tarmogoyf, and Vengevine while using Survival of the Fittest to tutor for specific creatures. It also integrates a combo aspect with Vengevine and powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice. The archetype emphasizes resource management and utilizing synergies between cards like Mother of Runes and Noble Hierarch to maintain board control and pressure opponents. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a mix of control and combo strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful board presence by utilizing cards like Basking Rootwalla and Vengevine, while using Survival of the Fittest to find key creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent with cards like Force of Will and Stifle, while also applying pressure with Aggro creatures like Noble Hierarch and Trygon Predator. The deck also includes versatile cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Wild Mongrel to provide additional utility. Overall, the deck focuses on efficiently and aggressively building a threatening board state to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on using Survival of the Fittest to tutor for creatures, utilizing cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Vengevine to control the board and generate value. With access to powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Iona, Shield of Emeria, this deck can both control the game and set up powerful combos. Mother of Runes and Swords to Plowshares help protect your creatures while disrupting your opponent's strategy. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's strategy of consistent creature tutoring and powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly apply pressure to the opponent by playing efficient threats like Nimble Mongoose and Tarmogoyf while disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Force of Will and Stifle. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Fire/Ice while also maintaining card advantage through cantrips like Brainstorm and Preordain. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan with dual lands like Tropical Island and Volcanic Island, as well as mana denial with Wasteland. The deck's goal is to win the game quickly through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to control the opponent's plays through counterspells and card manipulation, while using Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to maintain board control. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain card advantage, ultimately leading to a win through attrition. The deck relies on efficient counterspells and card draw to outlast opponents and control the game until it can establish a winning board state. It also incorporates cards like Vedalken Shackles and Karakas for additional control and disruption.

This Cradle Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, while also using permanent removal like Vindicate and Swords to Plowshares. The deck utilizes the synergy between Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with cards like Maze of Ith and Karakas. The inclusion of cards like Dark Confidant and Sensei's Divining Top help to maintain card advantage and ensure consistency in drawing key pieces of the deck.

This deck focuses on using Survival of the Fittest to quickly tutor for key combo pieces like Necrotic Ooze and Vengevine. It combines elements of control and combo to disrupt opponents while assembling its win conditions. The deck also includes cards like Fauna Shaman and Intuition for additional card selection and interaction. By efficiently utilizing its resources and graveyard recursion, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to create advantageous board states and secure victory.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure on the board with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tombstalker. Utilizing a mix of countermagic like Force of Will and disruption spells like Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and maintain board presence. Key cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help to smooth out draws and dig for additional threats. Wasteland and Stifle provide additional disruption by disrupting the opponent's mana base. With a blend of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on efficiently generating mana, drawing cards, and disrupting the opponent's hand to set up a win condition through storming off with Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam. It aims to quickly assemble the necessary resources to cast a high storm count spell and deal lethal damage in one turn. The deck utilizes a combination of mana acceleration, cantrips, and hand disruption to create an explosive combo turn that can overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to react.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game by using a combination of countermagic, land destruction, and creature suppression. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Stifle, Wasteland, and Standstill, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also generating card advantage through cards like Dark Confidant and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also includes powerful cards like Phyrexian Dreadnought and Mishra's Factory to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. Overall, the deck aims to dominate the game through strategic control and efficient resource management.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to fill your graveyard quickly with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, then use cards like Bridge from Below and Narcomoeba to create a swarm of zombie tokens. By using cards like Dread Return, you can then bring back powerful creatures like Iona, Shield of Emeria or Terastodon to control the game. Utilizing various self-mill and discard effects, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a graveyard-based strategy while disrupting their game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro - Eva Green deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Carnophage, Tarmogoyf, and Hypnotic Specter, along with removal spells like Diabolic Edict and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Dark Confidant and Phyrexian Negator adds card advantage and additional threats to the deck. The mana base is focused on producing black mana efficiently, with cards like Bayou and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Goblin creatures. By utilizing powerful Goblin cards like Goblin Lackey, Goblin Ringleader, and Goblin Warchief, the deck aims to quickly build up a strong board presence and deal damage efficiently. Additionally, cards like Goblin Chieftain and Siege-Gang Commander provide additional support and versatility to adapt to different situations. This deck focuses on tempo and early aggression to put pressure on the opponent and secure victory before they can develop their own game plan.

This Legacy Goblins Aggro deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on opponents with low-cost, efficient creatures like Goblin Lackey and Goblin Piledriver. Utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Rishadan Port to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain board control. The deck also includes cards like Goblin Ringleader and Goblin Matron to help dig for key pieces of the deck. With a mix of direct damage from cards like Gempalm Incinerator and strong finishers like Siege-Gang Commander, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive Goblin tribal strategy.

This deck focuses on using Survival of the Fittest to search for key creatures like Vengevine and Loyal Retainers, while also controlling the board with cards like Iona, Shield of Emeria and Wispmare. The deck can switch between a control strategy by using Umezawa's Jitte and Tarmogoyf, or a combo strategy by discarding Arrogant Wurm with Lion's Eye Diamond for massive advantage. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with Noble Hierarch and Chrome Mox to quickly get ahead in the game. Overall, the strategy is to adapt to different situations and outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain the upper hand. It also utilizes cards like Standstill and Mishra's Factory to slow down opponents while gaining advantage. The deck also includes land destruction elements like Wasteland and Crucible of Worlds to disrupt opponents' mana bases. With access to versatile sideboard options through Cunning Wish, the deck can adapt to various matchups and strategically outmaneuver opponents to secure victory.
